info.name: FCC tweaked
info.description: Tweaks to the learn.FreeCodeCamp.org CSS to fix some of the features that most annoy me with the new release.
info.additionalInfo:
I got rid of all the scrollbars.
I swapped everything to a dark theme with a nice terminal green (which is my personal preference for code).
I got rid of the campfire green on all the buttons/headers.
I got rid of the “motivational message” in between lessons.
I got rid of the search bar — I neither want, nor need it.
I removed all of the indent and matched bracket coloring in the editor.
I increased font sizes pretty much across the board.
I disabled the intellisense.

Edit: Modified styles for links and code on project assignment pages - the links were white on white, and code blocks didn't have enough contrast. (June 7, 2018 - P1xt)

Edit: Modified styles for links on section intro pages - the links were white on white. (June 7, 2018 - P1xt)

Edit: Bugfix - changed the selectors for heading resize to be more specific because the h4 resize interfered with the tests of one of the lessons. (June 7, 2018 - P1xt)

Edit: fix background color for block quotes in challenges. (June 11, 2018)

Edit: make header on instruction panel less monstrously huge (June 11, 2018)

Edit: finish removing popup intellisense (June 11, 2018)
